string-array.name: levels
string-array.item: In this group the voltage levels for the cells are set. The levels are stored both on the main board and on all additional boards.

MAX VOLTAGE:
 If the cell voltage exceeds the maximum voltage, the battery charging process will be paused or stopped.


MIN VOLTAGE:
 If the cell voltage drops below the minimum voltage, the discharge of the battery will be paused or stopped.


START BALANCING:
 The cell voltage above which the cell voltage balancing process begins. Balancing is only performed during the charging process. The balancing process at this point is performed by the central module. Also this level is used to provide hysteresis during charging. That is, when the charge is finished, the charge will start again if the voltage on at least one cell drops below this level.


STOP BALANCING:
 The cell voltage above which the balancer turns on on the add-on board regardless of the main board signals and regardless of whether it is charging or discharging. It is recommended that this level be set at or close to the maximum value.


CHARGED VOLTAGE:
 The cell voltage at which all cells are considered to be charged when reached. It is recommended to set this level between startbal and bal.


ALLOWED VOLTAGE:
 Used to provide a load trip hysteresis at the lower voltage threshold. This level is also used to enable the "Turtle" mode.


CRITICAL MIN VOLTAGE:
 The critical low voltage level of a cell. If at least one cell voltage is below this level, it is prohibited to charge, discharge or turn on the dc/dc converter.

string-array.name: current
string-array.item:
INP TYPE:
 Source type.
 0 - undefined,
 1 - ADC input,
 2 - USART input,
 3 - RS485 input


INP NUMBER:
 Input number.
 Makes sense only for ADC inputs. For old style RS485 sensors set 101 (20 first instances).


ZERO LEVEL:
 Value corresponding to zero current. Smaller is negative current. A larger value is positive. 
◦ For USART input this is the ADC value. It can be found out with the command diag/current. The value in brackets is the ADC value.


AMPER ON VOLT:
 ◦ For ADC input this is the multiplier to convert the sensor output voltage to current. For example, we know that a change of 10 millivolts (0.01 volts) in the sensor output voltage corresponds to a current of 1 amp. So the value of this parameter is 100 (1/0.01 = 100).
 ◦ For USART and RS485 input this is the multiplier M in the formula C = M * Adc. 
The resolution of the ADC is 4096. If the sensor measures current from -400 to +400 Amps we get a range of 800A. 800/4096 = 0,195. That is, 195 mA per ADC unit. Considering that the return value in milliamps, this parameter is 195.


MIN FIXED CURRENT:
 Current value in milliamps. The minimum value of current that is counted. For example, current less than 1 amp will not be considered due to sensor error. The temperature drift of the electronic components used causes the device to "catch" current of 0.5A or -0.7A in the absence of real current. With a measured current range of -200A to +200A, the minimum current of 1A will be 0.5%. This is consistent with the accuracy of most meters. The value is always rounded to 100mA. The maximum value of the parameter is 25000mA.

string-array.name: charger
string-array.item:
OUT TYPE:
 Source type.
 0 - undefined
 1 - Power Outputs
 2 - PWM Outputs
 3 - CAN device
 4 - Combined.
 Combined output: 2 outputs are used - logical and PWM. Logic switches on the relay, PWM - regulates the charging current.


OUT NUMBER:
 For logic and PWM outputs, the output number.
 For CAN set: 0 - off, 1 - CU: "NanjingPengtu", "TC carger (Elcon)". In the future the list of models will be expanded.


START TIME:
 Start time in deciseconds.
 For PWM it is the action time of the duty cycle.


START PWM:
 For PWM. 0 to 255.


HOLD PWM:
 For PWM only.
 Hold Quotient. 0 to 255.

string-array.name: charging
string-array.item:
INP TYPE:
 0 - undefined
 1 - ADC(Inputs)
 2 - Opto inputs (Inp OptoN)
 3 - CAN device


INP NUMBER:
 For CAN - 0.
 The type of the DUT is defined in the "charger" section. From the DUT we get only the signal to the network and without the command "charger" is meaningless.


LOGIC LEVEL:
 ADC only.
 Logic level voltage in millivolts. For other types specify 0.

string-array.name: ignition
string-array.item:
INP TYPE:
 0 - undefined
 1 - ADC(Inputs)
 2 - Opto inputs (Inp OptoN)
 3 - CAN device


INP NUMBER:
 For CAN - currently not applicable. Specify 0.


LOGIC LEVEL:
 ADC only.
 Logic level voltage in millivolts. For other types specify 0.

string-array.name: power
string-array.item:
OUT TYPE:
 Source type.
 0 - undefined
 1 - Power Outputs
 2 - PWM Outputs
 3 - CAN device


OUT NUMBER:
 For logic and PWM outputs - output number.
 For CAN set:
 0 - off
 1 - Curtis controller
 2 - MesDea Vehicle
 3 - BMZ
 The list will be expanded in the future.


START TIME:
 Only for PWM. Start time.
 For logical - delay of the output actuation.


START PWM:
 For PWM. The quadrature at the start. From 0 to 255.
 For logical - output number for automatic "forward" command.
 0 - if the function is not used.
 This is used when controlling the Curtis controller. To eliminate the error of violating the sequence of control signals.


HOLD PWM:
 For PWM only. Holding quadrature. From 0 to 255.
 For logical - delay of the "forward" command, after the output is triggered. In deciseconds. The maximum value is 255.

string-array.name: precharge
string-array.item: If this command is configured, a signal will be given a 1.5 second before the main contactor turns on, according to the settings of this command.

OUT TYPE:
 Source type.
 0 - undefined
 1 - Power Outputs
 2 - PWM Outputs
 3 - CAN device


OUT NUMBER:
 For logic and PWM outputs - output number.
 For CAN:
 0 - off
 1 - Curtis controller
 In the future the list will be expanded.


START TIME:
 For PWM only


START PWM:
 For PWM only. Quarterness at start. From 0 to 255.


HOLD PWM:
 For PWM only. Holding quadrature. From 0 to 255.

string-array.name: maincontactor
string-array.item: Command to turn on the main contactor. Turns ON when the charge and discharge signals are applied. Turns off only when input signals disappear and in critical situations.

OUT TYPE:
 Source type.
 0 - undefined
 1 - Power Outputs
 2 - PWM Outputs


OUT NUMBER:
 For logic and PWM outputs - output number.


START TIME:
 For PWM only


START PWM:
 For PWM only. Quarterness at start. From 0 to 255.


HOLD PWM:
 For PWM only. Holding quadrature. From 0 to 255.

string-array.name: chcurrentmax
string-array.item:
ZERO LEVEL: 
The value at the ADC input in millivolts, corresponding to zero current.


LEVEL MAX: 
 The value at the ADC input in millivolts, corresponding to maximum current.

The parameter is only applicable when using CAN-bus or hybrid controllers. Before version 1.07.45 there was the parameter "Current, mA". Removed due to its transfer to the "charger" command.


It is possible to regulate the current with a remote controller (variable resistor).
 If regulation is not needed, specify 0.

string-array.name: discurrentmax
string-array.item:
MAX CURRENT: 
Maximum current in Amperes


ZERO LEVEL: 
The value at the ADC input in millivolts, corresponding to zero current.


LEVEL MAX: 
 The value at the ADC input in millivolts, corresponding to maximum current.

The parameter is only applicable when using CAN-bus or hybrid controllers.
 It is possible to regulate the current with a remote controller (variable resistor).
 If regulation is not needed, specify 0.



Added in version "1.07.51"

string-array.name: thermostat1
string-array.item:
SOURCE: 
0 - неопределено 
1 - Temp Sensors 1 
2 - Temp Sensors 2 
3 - Temp Sensors 3 
4 - Temp Sensors 4 
5 - from BMS 
6 - Curtis, inverter temp sensor 
7 - Curtis, motor temp sensor


TYPE: (Thermostat types) 
0 - turn on when the temperature rises 
1 - turn on when the temperature drops 
2 - switching on when ignition or charge is turned on. Increase PWM duty cycle when exceeded (start temp).



Description of the thermostat types:


◦ SWITCHING ON WHEN THE TEMPERATURE RISES -> 0 

For the logical output (Power Output), when the measured temperature exceeds of the measured temperature above (high temp), a logical 1 is sent to the output. logical 1. When the temperature drops below (low temp)a logical 0 is output. This provides for temperature hysteresis.

▪ For PWM output. If the temperature exceeds (low temp) PWM is turned on at (start pwm) and rises to (hight temp), at which Reaching which it takes the value (max pwm).



◦ SWITCHING ON WHEN THE TEMPERATURE DROPS -> 1 

For the logic output (Power Output) when the temperature to be measured drops below (low temp). of the measured temperature below (low temp), a logical 1. If the temperature rises above (high temp) a logical 0 is output.

▪ For PWM output. If the temperature decreases below (hight temp) the PWM is switched on at (start pwm) and rises to (low temp), when reached, it takes the value (max pwm).



◦ TURNS ON WHEN THE IGNITION OR CHARGE IS TURNED ON -> 2


▪ For PWM output. When the ignition or charger is switched on the PWM on (start pwm) is switched on. When the temperature exceeds temperature (low temp) the PWM duty cycle rises to (hight temp), when reached, it takes the value (max pwm).

▪ Not implemented for the logic output.

string-array.name: thermostat2
string-array.item:
SOURCE: 
0 - неопределено 
1 - Temp Sensors 1 
2 - Temp Sensors 2 
3 - Temp Sensors 3 
4 - Temp Sensors 4 
5 - from BMS 
6 - Curtis, inverter temp sensor 
7 - Curtis, motor temp sensor

Description of the thermostat types:

For the logical output (Power Output), when the measured temperature exceeds of the measured temperature above (high temp), a logical 1 is sent to the output. logical 1. When the temperature drops below (low temp)a logical 0 is output. This provides for temperature hysteresis.

▪ For PWM output. If the temperature exceeds (low temp) PWM is turned on at (start pwm) and rises to (hight temp), at which Reaching which it takes the value (max pwm).



◦ SWITCHING ON WHEN THE TEMPERATURE DROPS -> 1 

For the logic output (Power Output) when the temperature to be measured drops below (low temp). of the measured temperature below (low temp), a logical 1. If the temperature rises above (high temp) a logical 0 is output.

▪ For PWM output. If the temperature decreases below (hight temp) the PWM is switched on at (start pwm) and rises to (low temp), when reached, it takes the value (max pwm).



◦ TURNS ON WHEN THE IGNITION OR CHARGE IS TURNED ON -> 2


▪ For PWM output. When the ignition or charger is switched on the PWM on (start pwm) is switched on. When the temperature exceeds temperature (low temp) the PWM duty cycle rises to (hight temp), when reached, it takes the value (max pwm).

▪ Not implemented for the logic output.

string-array.name: temptypes
string-array.item:
SENSOR TYPES: 
0 - NTC 3,3k 
1 - NTC 3,0k 
2 - NTC 4,7k 
3 - NTC 10k 
11 - kty83 
12 - kty84.

string-array.name: speed
string-array.item:
INP TYPE: 
0 - undefined 
2 - Opto inputs 
4 - Speed inputs 
5 - RS485-sensor


For RS485 sensors there are several possible ways of interpreting parameters: 
1. Sensor outputting pseudo-RPM. This is the number of responses per second multiplied by 60. A simple sensor with a hall sensor on board.


2. Sensor which gives out real RPM. This can be an adapter controller.


3. A sensor which gives out speed. For example a GPS sensor. For all types (inp num) will be the address on the bus. If there is only one sensor then this value is usually equal to 1. 

For step 1 (rotation poles) is the number of times the sensor is triggered per revolution multiplied by the reduction, if the sensor is installed on the motor axis. If the reduction is not an integer, the correct speed readings will have to be If the reduction is not an integer then the correct speed readings have to be adjusted with the (wheel length mm) modification. 

For steps 2 (rotation poles) is the reduction value. 

For steps 3 (rotation poles) and (wheel length mm) have no meaning and will be ignored.


Warning. The first revision of the device requires a restart after speed sensor settings!

string-array.name: rpm
string-array.item:
INP TYPE: 
0 - undefined 
2 - Opto inputs 
4 - Speed inputs

string-array.name: chtemp
string-array.item:
MIN TEMP: 
Minimum allowable temperature in degrees Celsius during charging.


MAX TEMP: 
Maximum allowed temperature during charge


To disable control, run the command -101 and 101

string-array.name: pwrtemp
string-array.item:
MIN TEMP: 
Minimum allowable temperature in degrees Celsius during discharging.


MAX TEMP: 
Maximum allowed temperature during discharge


To disable control, run the command -101 and 101

string-array.name: can
string-array.item: CAN speed settings \nWARNING! Device need reboot for apply changes!

string-array.name: accell
string-array.item:
ADC INP: 
The number of the input. From which the voltage that determines the throttle pedal position will be read.


BACKWARD MAX (mv): 
Value at which backward speed will be maximum.


BACKWARD MIN (mv): 
The start of backward rotation of the engine.


FORWARD MAX (mv): 
Start of engine forward rotation.


FORWARD MAX (mv): 
Maximum forward speed.


If all levels are entered - it is like controlling a joystick. If only forward movement, the values (Backward max) and (Backward min) must be 0.

string-array.name: alarm
string-array.item:
OUT NUM: 
The number of the output to which the 12v will be fed when an error occurs.


MAX TEMP (℃): 
The temperature value on any of the cells at which the alarm the alarm will be triggered. In degrees Celsius.
